title: [Installation] Path question
body:
Is there a reason League of Legends continues to install directory to the C:/ drive, as opposed to a directory such as program files? I personally hate the clutter when I need other files on my C:/ drive.

If installation path no longer (or never did) matter(s), why does it default to C:/?

Thanks,
Shadow

replies.body:
It is a bit direct saying "any game" needs to be installed on C:/. That does not hold true for all steam games, and mine craft which both installs under C:/Program Files x86, much cleaner. League is the only game I personally seen install directly to C:/ as default without reasoning.

In short, if I install it in my program files, will the game have issues later?

Typically, any games need to be installed onto the C drive to make sure they're able to run properly. You can try installing League to an external drive if you need by changing the default install directory in the installation.
